title: Benches clear after Jays SS Gimenez hit by pitch

title: Jays join Dodgers in wearing Vesia's '51' on caps

title: Sources: Teams eye Seahawks vets in trade talks

title: Tech wrecked: NC St hands No. 8 Jackets 1st loss
content: Playing without injured running back Hollywood Smothers, the ACC's rushing leader, NC State stunned No. 8 Georgia Tech 48-36 on Saturday night, ending the Yellow Jackets' unbeaten run, and giving the Wolfpack their first win over a top-10 foe since 2021.

title: UGA 'just won't go away,' rallies past Florida
content: Described by coach Kirby Smart as a team that "just won't go away," Georgia rallied for a 24-20 victory over Florida on Saturday, but it was nothing new for a squad that has trailed in the fourth quarter of four SEC games this season, winning three times.

title: Ravens deal ex-Pro Bowl CB Alexander to Eagles
content: The Eagles added cornerback depth on Saturday, acquiring former Pro Bowl CB Jaire Alexander and a 2027 seventh-round pick from the Ravens in exchange for a 2026 sixth-round pick.

title: Cristobal rues mistakes as Miami's CFP hopes dim
content: T.J. Harden scored on a 1-yard run in overtime, and SMU upset No. 10 Miami 26-20 on Saturday, handing the Hurricanes their second loss in three weeks and damaging the CFP hopes of a team that climbed to No. 2 in the country on the strength of a 5-0 start.

title: Grizzlies suspend Morant for detrimental conduct

content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

content: Police said the duo told them that they target two-wheelers that are parked hurriedly by owners in public places.

content: The State government has rolled out the Kalika Deepa programme to help students from class 4 to 6 of government schools to enhance competency in mathematics, English, and Kannada, with the help of Artificial Intelligence

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs paddy procurement during lean season not so lean anymore
content: According to¬†the data available on the Central Food Grains Procurement Portal, the lean season‚Äôs share of paddy was a little less than 16% four years go. During the September 2024 to August 2025 procurement year, it rose to around 40%

title: Andhra Pradesh temple stampede: Lokesh says rush of devotees was unexpected
content: Nine out of 10 have visited the temple for the first time on Saturday. The local police, administration or the temple management had no idea that such a huge devotee turnout will be there, the Minister said

content: Global recognition celebrates the city‚Äôs centuries-old Awadhi cuisine, living food traditions and inclusive cultural heritage

content: The BRS while it was in power for 10 years had failed to tackle civic issues in areas such as Borabanda and today the same party claims it would bring about changes there, the CM said

content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byregowda stated that the State Government would submit a memorandum to the Centre seeking funds to compensate the damage caused to public instructure due to rains

title: Former spokesperson blames BJP leadership for councillor‚Äôs suicide
content: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation councillor died by suicide in September this year, following a financial crisis at a cooperative society he had headed. Spokesperson M.S. Kumar says the society he had helmed too is struggling due to non-payment of dues by BJP leaders and workers

content: Approved under the India Semiconductor Mission, the integrated facility is expected to be operational by 2027-28, and entails an investment of ‚Çπ2,067 crore

content: Telangana students will now have access to 85% of these seats, while the remaining 15% will continue to be open to All-India candidates

content: Actor Mammootty, the chief guest, made his first public appearance after a gap of eight months following a break from acting to undergo medical treatment.

content: Nayab Singh Saini says the Deen Dayal Lado Lakshmi scheme is aimed at promoting self-reliance and economic empowerment

content: He urges Hathiramji Mutt Committee members not to believe the misconceptions being spread that the entire mutt will be demolished

content: India‚Äôs State governments have in the past employed private companies to seed clouds, when their regions faced drought; the results have been hit-and-miss.

content: The managements said this was the last option before the colleges and urged the universities to postpone examinations under their jurisdiction as the colleges would be closed

content: Youth Congress State general secretary had reportedly gone to the station to visit the UDF workers who were taken into custody following the clash at Perambra on October 10

title: On Camera, Bengaluru Cab Driver Rams Bike After Argument
content: Another road rage incident has been reported from Bengaluru, where a cab driver deliberately rammed his car into a bike following an argument.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Nears 'Severe' Mark, Thick Smog Lowers Visibility
content: The national capital witnessed a sharp deterioration in air quality on Sunday morning, with pollution levels slipping deep into the 'very poor' category and touching 'severe' levels in several parts of Delhi-NCR.

title: Odisha Man, 72, Killed On Suspicion Of Practising Witchcraft, 2 Arrested
content: A 72-year-old man was allegedly killed by two miscreants on the suspicion that he practiced witchcraft, in Chandaka area on the outskirts of Bhubaneswar, police said on Saturday.

title: 10 Stabbed On London-Bound Train, 2 Suspects Arrested
content: Armed police, backed by police cars and a fleet of ambulances, swarmed a railway station in Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire, after the alarm was raised about the attack.

title: Class 4 Girl Jumps To Death In Jaipur School, No Bloodstains At Site
content: A 9-year-old girl died on Saturday afternoon after allegedly jumping off the fourth floor of a private school in Jaipur.

title: JDU's Anant Singh Arrested In Jan Suraaj Worker's Murder Case
content: Jan Suraaj supporter Dular Chand Yadav was killed while he was campaigning for Jan Suraaj Party's candidate and his nephew Priyadarshi Piyush in Mokama.

title: "Guns-A-Blazing": Trump's Threat To Nigeria Over 'Killing Of Christians'
content: President Donald Trump on Saturday threatened to send US forces into Nigeria with "guns-a-blazing" if Africa's most populous country does not stem what he described as the killing of Christians by Islamists.

title: Trump Calls Meet With Xi "Great One," Says It Will Bring "Everlasting Peace"
content: United States President Donald Trump said on Sunday that his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping was "a great one" and would bring lasting peace and success for both nations.

title: 21 Dead, Over 30 Missing In Kenya Landslide: Interior Minister
content: At least 21 people died and more than 30 were still missing in a landslide on Saturday caused by heavy rains in western Kenya, the interior minister said.

title: 'Babies Will Starve': Kamala Harris Slams Trump's $300 Million Ballroom Plan
content: Kamala Harris unleashed a blistering tirade against President Donald Trump, blasting his plan to construct a $300 million ballroom at the White House, an expansion that would reportedly demolish the East Wing.

title: Raj Thackeray Joins Opposition Alliance In "March For Truth"
content: In a rare show of opposition unity, leaders of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) and the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) came together in Mumbai on Friday to protest alleged irregularities in the state's voter lists.

title: "Society Has Accepted ": RSS Leader On Mallikarjun Kharge's "Ban" Remark
content: The face-off between the Congress and the BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, has escalated with party chief Mallikarjun Kharge's comment that the organisation should be banned.

title: Woman Charged Over Louvre Museum Heist Tears Up In Court
content: A woman arrested this week along with four other suspects over the unprecedented jewel heist at the Louvre was charged and remanded in custody on Saturday.

title: PM Modi Unveils Projects Worth Rs 14,260 Crore In Chhattisgarh
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated Chhattisgarh's 25th anniversary celebrations at the Rajat Mahotsav in Nava Raipur, with laying foundation stones for transformative projects worth over Rs 14,260 crore, spanning roads, energy, indu

title: Poll Body Orders Transfers After Death Of Jan Suraaj 'Supporter' In Bihar
content: The Election Commission has ordered the transfer of several administration ad police officers in Bihar following the murder of a man who was allegedly a supporter of Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party.

title: AIADMK Leader KA Sengottaiyan Slams EPS After Expulsion, Vows Legal Fight
content: A day after being expelled from the AIADMK, veteran leader and nine-time MLA KA Sengottaiyan hit back at party chief Edappadi K Palanisamy (EPS), calling the decision "illegal" and announcing that he would approach the court.

title: Venkateswara Swamy Temple Stampede Highlights: PM Modi Says He Is Pained By Andhra Stampede
content: Hundreds of devotees had gathered at the temple in Kashibugga on the occasion of 'Karthika Ekadashi'.

title: On Congress Chief M Kharge's RSS Ban Demand, Amit Shah's Counter
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh or RSS, which is in its centenary year, has given this country two very popular prime ministers, said Home Minister Amit Shah, countering Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's demand to ban the organisation.

title: 2 Killed, 5 Injured In Collision Between School Van, SUV In Rajasthan
content: Two girls were killed, while five other students were injured after a private school van collided with an SUV here on Saturday morning, an official said.

title: 21-Year-Old UP Woman Dies By Suicide After Losing Rs 5,000 In Cyber Fraud
content: A 21-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide after falling victim to cyber fraud, police said on Saturday.

title: At 114, 2025 stampede toll 2nd-highest in recent years; Andhra tragedy 6th incident this year
content: This year has witnessed a tragic surge in stampedes, claiming at least 114 lives, the second-highest toll in recent years. Major incidents include a crowd crush in Hathras, UP, and a stampede at the Venkateswara Swamy Temple in Andhra Pradesh, highlighting systemic failures in crowd management and emergency response.

title: Watch: Hamas loots Gaza aid truck; US military drone catches it on camera
content: US Central Command released drone footage showing suspected Hamas operatives looting an aid truck in southern Gaza. The operatives attacked the driver and stole the truck and its contents, undermining international efforts to deliver vital assistance. Senator Marco Rubio condemned the act, calling Hamas an impediment to aid for Gazan civilians.

title: Mokama murder case: JD(U) candidate Anant Singh arrested in connection with Jan Suraaj worker‚Äôs killing
content: Janata Dal (United) candidate Anant Singh was arrested by Patna Police in connection with the murder of Jan Suraaj Party worker Dularchand Yadav. The 75-year-old was shot and run over during a clash between rival groups while campaigning. The arrest follows evidence and eyewitness accounts, with accomplices also taken into custody.

title: Knife attack in Karnataka: 5 stabbed during Kannada Rajyotsava celebrations; 2 critical
content: Five individuals were injured, with two sustaining serious wounds, during Kannada Rajyotsava celebrations in Belagavi. Miscreants reportedly stabbed the victims indiscriminately near Laxmi Complex before fleeing. Authorities are investigating the incident, suspecting outsiders may be involved.

title: IND vs SA: Rain threat looms! What happens if weather spoils women's world cup final
content: India and South Africa's ICC Women's World Cup final faces a weather threat in Navi Mumbai, with rain potentially disrupting the highly anticipated clash. A reserve day is in place, and the ICC has outlined rules for reduced overs or shared trophies if play is impossible.

title: Alien object: Musk & Rogan discuss 3I/ATLAS heading toward Earth
content: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual nickel composition and trajectory. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast with Elon Musk touched upon potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial origins.

title: Gujarat: 15-yr-old kills brother, rapes and murders pregnant sister-in-law; shows no remorse
content: A 15-year-old boy in Gujarat allegedly murdered his elder brother and six-months-pregnant sister-in-law, then confessed to raping her before killing her. The motive appears to be resentment over his brother's mistreatment. The mother is arrested for aiding in the burial and evidence destruction. The crime was uncovered after the sister-in-law's family became suspicious.

title: ‚ÄòBlood stains were washed‚Äô: Girl dies after falling from 4th floor of school
content: A nine-year-old girl died after falling from the fourth floor of Neerja Modi School in Jaipur under suspicious circumstances. Police have filed a negligence case against the school management and staff, with CCTV footage recovered and FSL teams collecting samples. The school principal stated the girl asked for washroom access before the incident.

title: Bopanna's retirement: Sachin Tendulkar - 'Always believed sport reveals character'
content: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar lauded Rohan Bopanna's inspiring career as the Indian tennis star officially retired after over two decades. Bopanna, who achieved remarkable milestones including becoming the oldest Grand Slam winner and World No. 1, expressed his pride in representing India. He remains committed to developing the sport through his academy and UTR Tennis Pro.

title: China chill: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says China made it clear; 'they don't want Nvidia there'
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the U.S. government to reconsider restrictions on AI chip exports to China, warning that isolating the U.S. from China's vast developer ecosystem could cede AI talent to rivals. Despite China's effective shutdown of Nvidia's operations, the company secured significant deals with the U.S. Department of Energy, underscoring a pivot to fortified U.S. ties.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe‚Äôs heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Multiple people stabbed on London-bound train: Nine critically injured; what we know so far
content: Two individuals were apprehended on Saturday following a stabbing incident aboard a train in Cambridgeshire, resulting in multiple passenger injuries and a significant emergency response. Rail services were suspended as armed police secured the scene at Huntingdon station, with several victims transported to hospital. An investigation is ongoing.

title: Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi mark 2nd anniversary, share pic withbabyVaayuv
content: Varun Tej Konidela and Lavanya Tripathi celebrated their second wedding anniversary with heartfelt social media tributes and adorable family photos featuring their son, Vaayuv. Their journey, which began on the sets of 'Mister' in 2016, has blossomed into a beautiful family life. This milestone marks their first anniversary as parents, adding a new layer of joy to their union.

title: Science swipe: Elon Musk says Bill Gates isn‚Äôt strong in sciences; cites direct conversations
content: Elon Musk recently stated Bill Gates "is not strong in the sciences," despite Microsoft's success. Musk recounted a meeting where Gates doubted Tesla's long-range electric semi-trucks, even after Musk pointed to PepsiCo's operational fleet. This exchange highlights their ongoing public disagreements on technology and innovation.

title: Woman‚Äôs decomposed body found in rented Bengaluru house
content: A 25-year-old woman, Supriya, was discovered deceased in her locked Bengaluru residence on Saturday. Her body was found hanging in a room on the third floor. Police have seized her mobile phone for forensic analysis. A case of unnatural death has been registered following a complaint from her family.

title: 'Fight over light switch': Bengaluru techie kills manager with dumbbell; suspect arrested
content: A workplace dispute over switching off lights tragically escalated into murder in Bengaluru. A 41-year-old manager was bludgeoned to death with a dumbbell by a colleague after a heated argument. The accused, a 24-year-old technical executive, surrendered to the police. Investigations into the shocking incident are ongoing.

title: First Indian woman! 32-yo Pundole on the brink of history with Ferrari
content: Pune's Diana Pundole is set to make history as the first Indian woman to race a Ferrari internationally. Competing in the Ferrari Club Challenge Middle East from November 2025 to April 2026, she will drive the powerful 296 Challenge car across renowned F1 tracks in the region. This significant achievement aims to inspire more Indian women to embrace motorsport.

title: ‚ÄòAct of God, no one responsible‚Äô: Builder of Andhra temple where 9 died in stampede
content: A stampede at a privately run temple in Srikakulam district, Andhra Pradesh, killed nine devotees and injured over 25 when a railing collapsed on a narrow staircase. Panic ensued in a crowd of over 20,000 gathered for Karthika Ekadashi, with poor crowd control and lack of official clearance contributing to the tragedy. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Blocking global talent: H-1B bans hurt US innovation; jobs and research on the line
content: America's innovation edge is threatened as Florida proposes blocking H-1B hires, a move experts warn will stifle research and development.  The nation faces a critical shortage of skilled STEM professionals, with demographics and a lack of domestic talent exacerbating the issue.  Excluding international experts risks America falling behind in global technological advancements.

title: Women's World Cup: 'Superior to us in 1983!' - Kapil Dev backs India to create history
content: Legendary Kapil Dev lauded the Indian women's cricket team's exceptional performance, stating they are superior to his 1983 World Cup-winning squad. He urged fans to appreciate the team's intelligent and elevated style of play, not just the outcome of the upcoming World Cup final against South Africa. Dev believes the team is ready to create history.

title: US‚ÄìChina trade reset: From tariffs to rare earths ‚Äî What Trump and Xi agreed on
content: US and China have agreed to a temporary truce in their trade war, pausing new tariffs and export curbs. Key deals include China resuming significant soybean purchases, US cutting fentanyl-related tariffs, and China lifting rare-earth export restrictions. This de-escalation offers a year-long window for further negotiations.

title: Inside Epstein‚Äôs money trail: Unsealed files expose Wall Street, Russian bank connections
content: New documents reveal Jeffrey Epstein's financial ties to Wall Street figures, including Russian banks. JPMorgan Chase, which settled lawsuits for $290 million and $75 million, flagged over $1 billion in transactions linked to Epstein. Emails show discussions between Epstein and former JPMorgan executive Jes Staley about potential clients and meetings with Prince Andrew.

title: Delhi: November is here, brace yourself for most polluted fortnight; AQI back in ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô zone
content: Delhi's air quality has plunged into the 'very poor' category, with experts warning of a challenging fortnight ahead. Despite minimal stubble burning, local sources like vehicle emissions and construction dust are driving the pollution spike.  Respite is unlikely as the city braces for its most polluted period, with forecasts indicating continued poor air quality.

title: 'Intentional' explosion hits Harvard Medical School; police release suspects' photos
content: An early Saturday morning explosion at Harvard Medical School's Goldenson Building has been deemed 'intentional' by authorities. A police officer observed two masked individuals fleeing the scene just before the blast. While no injuries were reported, investigators are seeking public assistance to identify the suspects captured in released photos. The FBI is also involved in the ongoing investigation.

title: ‚ÄòBumrah ke‚Ä¶‚Äô: Pakistani fans cross line, Sahibzada caught laughing, clapping ‚Äî video
content: Pakistani cricketer Sahibzada Farhan faced criticism for his reaction to fans chanting obscenities about Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah.  The incident occurred during Pakistan's T20I series win against South Africa.  Farhan has a notable on-field rivalry with Bumrah.  The article also details Pakistan's victory in the final match.

title: Horses take centre stage at Pushkar fair this year with sales totalling Rs 75 lakh
content: The Pushkar annual cattle fair witnessed a significant shift this year as Marwadi and Kathiawadi horse sales overshadowed traditional bovine trade. Horses and camels are increasingly being purchased for transportation purposes in rural areas, with bulls seeing a sharp decline in sales due to modern farming equipment. The highest horse sale recorded was Rs 4.

title: Swifties slam Kayla Nicole over Halloween stunt involving Travis & Taylor
content: Kayla Nicole's Halloween costume and song choice sparked outrage among Swifties, who interpreted it as a jab at Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce. Fans accused Nicole of jealousy and obsession, viewing her post as a deliberate provocation. This incident highlights how quickly fandoms punish perceived slights, even years after a breakup.

title: MLB rumours: Yankees eye Cubs star outfielder as Cody Bellinger replacement
content: The New York Yankees are reportedly targeting elite left-handed power hitter Kyle Tucker to bolster their lineup after a disappointing postseason.  With a potential massive deal, Tucker's blend of power, speed, and discipline makes him an ideal long-term cornerstone, potentially closing the door on Cody Bellinger and ushering in a new offensive era.

title: Shane Bieber‚Äôs wife reacts to Alejandro Kirk‚Äôs wife‚Äôs viral World Series post
content: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: End of an era! Kane Williamson retires; calls for 'clarity‚Äô ahead of T20 world cup
content: New Zealand's Kane Williamson has retired from T20 internationals to provide clarity for the team ahead of next year's T20 World Cup. The 35-year-old leaves as the second-highest T20I run-scorer for New Zealand, having guided them to the 2021 T20 World Cup final. He will now focus on Test cricket and spending more time with his family.

title: Andhra temple tragedy: 9 killed in stampede; no prior approval, crowd overwhelms premises
content: A devastating stampede at a new Srikakulam temple claimed nine lives, including eight women and a boy, and injured over 25 during Karthika Ekadashi. A railing collapse on a crowded staircase triggered the panic. Authorities are investigating the lack of prior approval, poor crowd control, and inadequate security at the privately run shrine.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury update: Why he chose to stay back in Sydney - Inside story
content: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has been discharged from the hospital in Sydney after a week-long stay, including time in the ICU, following a fall during a match. He will remain in Sydney for follow-up care for the next seven to ten days, prioritising his complete well-being over an immediate return to cricket.

title: Sneako calls out Erika Kirk for JD Vance hug and Charlie Kirk comparison
content: A viral video shows Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, hugging Vice President JD Vance at a Turning Point USA event. Kirk's speech comparing Vance to her late husband sparked debate, with a subsequent hug drawing widespread online commentary. Streamer Sneako's mocking remarks added to the controversy, making the incident a major political talking point.

title: Government to issue bus safety checklist for RTOs after fire incidents
content: In response to recent bus fire tragedies, the government is mandating a safety checklist for RTOs to verify during vehicle renewals. This includes emergency exits, fire-resistant equipment, and passenger safety features. The move aims to enhance passenger safety and prevent future accidents, with stricter enforcement of the Bus Body Code now in effect for new buses.

title: Kerala free of extreme poverty, declares CM Pinarayi Vijayan; opposition calls it ‚Äòhoax‚Äô
content: Kerala has declared itself free of extreme poverty, becoming the first Indian state to achieve this milestone. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announced the feat, highlighting a meticulous process that identified and uplifted 64,006 families through micro-plans focusing on food, health, housing, and income. The government allocated significant funds for these initiatives.

title: Bold prediction! 'One-in-a-billion horoscope': Harmanpreet will lift Women's WC trophy
content: Scientific astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts a 90% chance for India to win the 2025 Women's World Cup against South Africa. He cites captain Harmanpreet Kaur's 'one-in-a-billion horoscope' and the team's 'Grey Lizards' as key factors. Despite South Africa's strong skipper Laura Wolvaardt, Lobo believes India's stars are aligned for a historic triumph.

title: After massive rescue op for almost 36 hrs, 6-yr-old boy‚Äôs body found in 50 ft well in Agra
content: A tragic incident unfolded in Agra where a six-year-old boy, Rihansh, lost his life after falling into a deep village well while playing football. Despite a massive 36-hour search operation involving expert divers and NDRF teams, the child's body was recovered late Saturday. Difficult conditions, including heavy silt and rising water levels, hampered rescue efforts.

title: Taylor Swift worried about security as Travis Kelce shifts focus to new season
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Exclusive: 'No pressure' ‚Äî Ex-India captain backs Harmanpreet's team ahead of Women's WC final
content: India's women's cricket team, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, aims to secure their maiden World Cup title against South Africa on Sunday.  Following a semifinal triumph over Australia, the team seeks to overcome past final defeats. Former captain Anjum Chopra expresses confidence in Kaur's leadership and the team's ability to win, while also urging caution against a strong South African side.

title: Dwight Howard divorce heats up after Amy Luciani‚Äôs bold Black marriage remark
content: NBA star Dwight Howard's wife, Amy Luciani, has offered marriage advice to young women. This comes after she filed for divorce, calling their union 'irretrievably broken'. Luciani's recent social media posts suggest a potential reconciliation. She spoke about what successful men seek in a partner. The couple's marital status remains unconfirmed.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô alleged K‚Äôyanna Barber affair escalates as Cardi B expects baby
content: Rapper Cardi B is reportedly expecting twins with NFL player Stefon Diggs, but the couple faces controversy. Diggs is also accused of fathering twins with another woman, K‚Äôyanna Barber, a situation neither party has publicly addressed. This alleged infidelity has caused fan uproar as Cardi B continues to share her pregnancy publicly.

title: Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik dies in accident; Tripura cricket mourns
content: Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik tragically passed away in a road accident at 40. A talented all-rounder for Tripura, Banik represented the state in numerous first-class, List A, and T20 matches. He also served as a selector for the U-16 team, leaving a significant mark on Tripura's cricket. His untimely demise has deeply saddened the cricketing fraternity.

title: Stephen Curry admits tough decision that strained relationship with Ayesha Curry
content: Stephen Curry shares a cherished memory of his wife, Ayesha Curry.  She stood by him when he faced a tough choice between college and the NBA draft in 2009.  Her support solidified their bond.  The couple has built a strong marriage and family over the years, staying away from public scrutiny.  Their enduring relationship is a testament to their commitment.

title: Bihar polls: Opinion poll predicts close victory for NDA; Tejashwi most preferred CM face
content: An opinion poll by JVC Poll on Times Now predicts the JD(U)-led NDA will retain power in Bihar, securing 120-140 seats in the 243-member assembly. Tejashwi Yadav leads the popularity chart for CM, while the NDA is projected to get 41-43% vote share. Elections are scheduled for November 6 and 11.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: the playbook for week 9 kicks off with the Ravens at the Dolphins . the column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: Wetzel: Louisiana Gov. made finding next LSU coach harder
content: the job of hiring a new coach will fall to a subcommittee set up by the school's 17-member Board of Supervisors . the job would fall to an interim athletic director verge Ausberry . if Landry empowers president Trump to make the selection, he'll be able to hire "the best football coach there is"

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M .

title: 2 Air India pilots grounded for operating flights without mandatory licence requirements
content: a co-pilot and a senior captain have been taken off flying duty . they operated a flight each month with a lapsed ELP licence . in the other, they did so without undergoing corrective training . the directorate general of civil aviation is investigating these lapses .

title: Recruiting intel: Vandy coming for UGA's QB; top prospect in the middle of LSU's coaching change
content: college football teams take the field Saturday, a potentially hectic final month before the early signing period for the 2026 recruiting class . the temperature is set to rise as top uncommitted prospects and flip targets visit campuses over the final four weeks of the college football regular season .

title: Tottenham were devoid of ideas vs. Chelsea, and fans are turning on Thomas Frank
content: Janusz Michallik sings the praises of Mois√©s Caicedo after his starring performance in Chelsea's win over Tottenham . the 1-0 defeat to Chelsea was greeted with a chorus of boos at both the halftime and fulltime whistles . his own players, Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence, appeared to ignore his request to stay on the pitch .

title: Week 10 truths: Miami is a mess, Ohio State looks like a sure thing
content: at points in history, the wisest among us believed, with some degree of certainty, that the earth was flat, that sea dragons consumed ships filled with gold, that Texas was back . in time, most of us who aren't Kyrie Irving have come to understand the folly of such ideas . they simply lacked information, but as we learn more, we refine our notions of how the world works .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Jaire Alexander, Michael Carter II to the Eagles
content: the 2025 NFL trade deadline is on Nov. 4 at 4 p.m. ET . a handful of 2024 draft picks have already found their way to new rosters . this week, the Titans traded Roger McCreary to the Rams, the 49ers shored up their pass rush .

title: Halloween face paint, confused time travelers: Week 10's CFB superlatives
content: the best of the wackiest from Week 10 of the 2025 season . a number of nontraditional superlatives will show some love to some of the sport's more offbeat stories . game day eye black is a classic tradition in football, but generally simple in execution .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: World Series champs -- again! Game 7 win cements Dodgers' dynasty
content: the los Angeles Dodgers closed out the Toronto Blue Jays with a 5-4 win in extra innings . it was easy to think about the fourth lefty on the franchise's bullpen depth chart . this lefty is Clayton Kershaw, who announced his retirement late in the season .

title: Mokama murder: EC orders replacement of two officials; seeks action compliance report
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. Read More
